current_definition: A (combination of) quality(ies) of an organism determined by the interaction of its genetic make-up and environment that differentiates specific instances of a species from other instances of the same species.
proposed_definition: A quality of an organism determined by the interaction of its genetic make-up and environment that differentiates specific instances of a species from other instances of the same species.
rationale: Current definition is excellent and already follows guidelines. Minor simplification removes unnecessary parenthetical.

proposed_definition: A biological process that involves the chemical reactions and pathways within a living organism for maintaining life.
rationale: Follows genus-differentia using parent "biological process" as genus.

current_definition: The percentage of guanine and cytosine nucleotides in DNA
proposed_definition: A quality that inheres in DNA by virtue of the proportion of guanine and cytosine nucleotides relative to total nucleotide content.
source_terms_consulted: D3O:gcMethod (mismatched to GC measurement tool, not content itself)
rationale: Rewritten to follow genus-differentia form using "quality" as genus, focusing on what GC content IS rather than how to measure it.

proposed_definition: An independent continuant that is spatially extended whose identity is independent of that of other entities and can be maintained through time.
rationale: Root class definition from BFO is appropriate and follows guidelines.

proposed_definition: A dependent entity that inheres in a bearer by virtue of how the bearer is related to other entities.
rationale: Root class definition from PATO follows guidelines with proper genus-differentia structure.

parent_classes: pH phenotype with numerical limits|delta phenotype with numerical limits
current_definition: A measure of the breadth of hydrogen ion concentrations that a microorganism can tolerate, calculated as the difference between the maximum and minimum viable pH values
proposed_definition: A pH phenotype that represents the breadth of hydrogen ion concentrations a microorganism can tolerate, quantified as the difference between maximum and minimum viable pH values.
source_terms_consulted: OBI:0001047 (pH meter - wrong match, device not phenotype)
rationale: Current is good but not genus-differentia form. Rewritten using "pH phenotype" as genus.

parent_classes: temperature phenotype with numerical limits|delta phenotype with numerical limits
current_definition: A measure of the breadth of thermal conditions that a microorganism can withstand, calculated as the difference between the maximum and minimum viable temperature values
proposed_definition: A temperature phenotype that represents the breadth of thermal conditions a microorganism can withstand, quantified as the difference between maximum and minimum viable temperatures.
rationale: Rewritten to use "temperature phenotype" as genus following guidelines.

parent_classes: temperature phenotype with numerical limits|optimum phenotype with numerical limits
current_definition: The specific temperature at which an organism exhibits maximum growth rate
proposed_definition: A temperature phenotype at which an organism exhibits maximum growth rate.
rationale: Current is descriptive. Rewritten to genus-differentia using "temperature phenotype" as genus.

parent_classes: temperature phenotype with numerical limits|growth range phenotype with numerical limits
current_definition: The span of temperatures within which an organism can grow
proposed_definition: A temperature phenotype that encompasses the span of temperatures within which an organism can grow.
rationale: Rewritten to genus-differentia using "temperature phenotype" as genus.

parent_classes: pH phenotype with numerical limits|optimum phenotype with numerical limits
current_definition: The specific hydrogen ion concentration at which a microorganism achieves its maximum growth rate and metabolic efficiency.
proposed_definition: A pH phenotype at which a microorganism achieves maximum growth rate.
rationale: Current is good but can be more concise. Rewritten to genus-differentia using "pH phenotype" as genus.

parent_classes: pH phenotype with numerical limits|growth range phenotype with numerical limits
current_definition: The span of hydrogen ion concentrations within which a microorganism can maintain cellular homeostasis and sustain growth.
proposed_definition: A pH phenotype that encompasses the span of hydrogen ion concentrations within which a microorganism can sustain growth.
rationale: Rewritten to genus-differentia using "pH phenotype" as genus.

parent_classes: salinity phenotype with numerical limits|optimum phenotype with numerical limits
current_definition: The specific concentration of sodium chloride at which a microorganism exhibits maximum growth rate and metabolic efficiency.
proposed_definition: A salinity phenotype at which a microorganism exhibits maximum growth rate.
rationale: Rewritten to genus-differentia using "salinity phenotype" as genus.

parent_classes: salinity phenotype with numerical limits|growth range phenotype with numerical limits
current_definition: The span of sodium chloride concentrations within which a microorganism can maintain osmotic balance and cellular functions.
proposed_definition: A salinity phenotype that encompasses the span of sodium chloride concentrations within which a microorganism can sustain growth.
rationale: Rewritten to genus-differentia using "salinity phenotype" as genus.

parent_classes: salinity phenotype with numerical limits|delta phenotype with numerical limits
current_definition: A measure of the breadth of sodium chloride concentrations that a microorganism can tolerate, calculated as the difference between the maximum and minimum viable salinity values.
proposed_definition: A salinity phenotype that represents the breadth of sodium chloride concentrations a microorganism can tolerate, quantified as the difference between maximum and minimum viable values.
rationale: Rewritten to genus-differentia using "salinity phenotype" as genus.

current_definition: A genomic feature characterized by a guanine-cytosine content percentage below 42.65% in an organism's DNA. Values with maximum value of 42.65 % GC.
proposed_definition: A GC content below 42.65% of total nucleotides.
rationale: Simplified to be concise, uses "GC content" as genus.

current_definition: A genomic feature characterized by a guanine-cytosine content percentage between 42.65% and 57% in an organism's DNA. Values ranging from 42.65 to 57 % GC.
proposed_definition: A GC content between 42.65% and 57% of total nucleotides.
rationale: Simplified to be concise, uses "GC content" as genus.

current_definition: A genomic feature characterized by a guanine-cytosine content percentage between 57% and 66.3% in an organism's DNA. Values ranging from 57 to 66.3 % GC.
proposed_definition: A GC content between 57% and 66.3% of total nucleotides.
rationale: Simplified to be concise, uses "GC content" as genus.

current_definition: A genomic feature characterized by a guanine-cytosine content percentage above 66.3% in an organism's DNA. Values with minimum value of 66.3 % GC.
proposed_definition: A GC content above 66.3% of total nucleotides.
rationale: Simplified to be concise, uses "GC content" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at temperatures below 10°C, typical of psychrophilic organisms. Values with maximum value of 10 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature optimum below 10°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature optimum" as genus. Remove organism characterization as that belongs in preference class.

current_definition: A temperature optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at temperatures between 10°C and 22°C, common in psychrophilic or psychrotolerant organisms. Values ranging from 10 to 22 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature optimum between 10°C and 22°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at temperatures between 22°C and 27°C, characteristic of mesophilic organisms. Values ranging from 22 to 27 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature optimum between 22°C and 27°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at temperatures between 27°C and 30°C, characteristic of mesophilic organisms. Values ranging from 27 to 30 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature optimum between 27°C and 30°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at temperatures between 30°C and 34°C, characteristic of mesophilic organisms. Values ranging from 30 to 34 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature optimum between 30°C and 34°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at temperatures between 34°C and 40°C, characteristic of mesophilic organisms. Values ranging from 34 to 40 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature optimum between 34°C and 40°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at temperatures above 40°C, typical of thermophilic organisms. Values with minimum value of 40 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature optimum above 40°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature range allowing microbial growth at temperatures below 10°C, characteristic of psychrophilic organisms. Values with maximum value of 10 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature range with values below 10°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature range" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature range allowing microbial growth at temperatures between 10°C and 22°C, characteristic of psychrophilic or psychrotolerant organisms. Values ranging from 10 to 22 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature range with values between 10°C and 22°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature range" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature range allowing microbial growth at temperatures between 22°C and 27°C, characteristic of mesophilic organisms. Values ranging from 22 to 27 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature range with values between 22°C and 27°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature range" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature range allowing microbial growth at temperatures between 27°C and 30°C, characteristic of mesophilic organisms. Values ranging from 27 to 30 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature range with values between 27°C and 30°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature range" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature range allowing microbial growth at temperatures between 30°C and 34°C, characteristic of mesophilic organisms. Values ranging from 30 to 34 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature range with values between 30°C and 34°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature range" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature range allowing microbial growth at temperatures between 34°C and 40°C, characteristic of mesophilic organisms. Values ranging from 34 to 40 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature range with values between 34°C and 40°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature range" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature range allowing microbial growth at temperatures above 40°C, characteristic of thermophilic organisms. Values with minimum value of 40 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature range with values above 40°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature range" as genus.

current_definition: A pH optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at hydrogen ion concentrations between pH 0 and 6, characteristic of acidophilic organisms. Values ranging from 0 to 6 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH optimum between pH 0 and 6.
rationale: Simplified using "pH optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A pH optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at hydrogen ion concentrations between pH 6 and 7, characteristic of neutrophilic or alkali-tolerant organisms. Values ranging from 6 to 7 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH optimum between pH 6 and 7.
rationale: Simplified using "pH optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A pH optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at hydrogen ion concentrations between pH 7 and 8, characteristic of neutrophilic, alkaliphilic, or alkali-tolerant organisms. Values ranging from 7 to 8 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH optimum between pH 7 and 8.
rationale: Simplified using "pH optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A pH optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at hydrogen ion concentrations between pH 8 and 14, characteristic of alkaliphilic or extremely alkaliphilic organisms. Values ranging from 8 to 14 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH optimum between pH 8 and 14.
rationale: Simplified using "pH optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A pH range allowing microbial growth at hydrogen ion concentrations between pH 0 and 4, characteristic of extremely acidophilic organisms. Values ranging from 0 to 4 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH range with values between pH 0 and 4.
rationale: Simplified using "pH range" as genus.

current_definition: A pH range allowing microbial growth at hydrogen ion concentrations between pH 4 and 6, characteristic of acidophilic organisms. Values ranging from 4 to 6 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH range with values between pH 4 and 6.
rationale: Simplified using "pH range" as genus.

current_definition: A pH range allowing microbial growth at hydrogen ion concentrations between pH 6 and 7, characteristic of neutrophilic organisms. Values ranging from 6 to 7 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH range with values between pH 6 and 7.
rationale: Simplified using "pH range" as genus.

current_definition: A pH range allowing microbial growth at hydrogen ion concentrations between pH 7 and 8, characteristic of neutrophilic or alkaliphilic organisms. Values ranging from 7 to 8 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH range with values between pH 7 and 8.
rationale: Simplified using "pH range" as genus.

current_definition: A pH range allowing microbial growth at hydrogen ion concentrations between pH 8 and 10, characteristic of alkaliphilic organisms. Values ranging from 8 to 10 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH range with values between pH 8 and 10.
rationale: Simplified using "pH range" as genus.

current_definition: A pH range allowing microbial growth at hydrogen ion concentrations between pH 10 and 14, characteristic of extremely alkaliphilic organisms. Values ranging from 10 to 14 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH range with values between pH 10 and 14.
rationale: Simplified using "pH range" as genus.

current_definition: A salinity optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at sodium chloride concentrations below 1%, characteristic of non-halophilic or halotolerant organisms. Values with maximum value of 1 % NaCl.
proposed_definition: A NaCl optimum below 1% concentration.
rationale: Simplified using "NaCl optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A salinity optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at sodium chloride concentrations between 1% and 3%, characteristic of slight halophiles or halotolerant organisms. Values ranging from 1 to 3 % NaCl.
proposed_definition: A NaCl optimum between 1% and 3% concentration.
rationale: Simplified using "NaCl optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A salinity optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at sodium chloride concentrations between 3% and 8%, characteristic of moderate halophiles or halotolerant organisms. Values ranging from 3 to 8 % NaCl.
proposed_definition: A NaCl optimum between 3% and 8% concentration.
rationale: Simplified using "NaCl optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A salinity optimum manifested as maximum microbial growth at sodium chloride concentrations above 8%, characteristic of extreme halophiles. Values with minimum value of 8 % NaCl.
proposed_definition: A NaCl optimum above 8% concentration.
rationale: Simplified using "NaCl optimum" as genus.

current_definition: A salinity range allowing microbial growth at sodium chloride concentrations below 1%, characteristic of non-halophilic organisms. Values with maximum value of 1 % NaCl.
proposed_definition: A NaCl range with values below 1% concentration.
rationale: Simplified using "NaCl range" as genus.

current_definition: A salinity range allowing microbial growth at sodium chloride concentrations between 1% and 3%, characteristic of slight halophiles. Values ranging from 1 to 3 % NaCl.
proposed_definition: A NaCl range with values between 1% and 3% concentration.
rationale: Simplified using "NaCl range" as genus.

current_definition: A salinity range allowing microbial growth at sodium chloride concentrations between 3% and 8%, characteristic of moderate halophiles. Values ranging from 3 to 8 % NaCl.
proposed_definition: A NaCl range with values between 3% and 8% concentration.
rationale: Simplified using "NaCl range" as genus.

current_definition: A salinity range allowing microbial growth at sodium chloride concentrations above 8%, characteristic of extreme halophiles. Values with minimum value of 8 % NaCl.
proposed_definition: A NaCl range with values above 8% concentration.
rationale: Simplified using "NaCl range" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of pH conditions that support an organism's growth, with a narrow range less than 1 pH unit. Values with maximum value of 1 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH delta of less than 1 pH unit.
rationale: Simplified using "pH delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of pH conditions that support an organism's growth, with a range between 1 and 2 pH units. Values ranging from 1 to 2 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH delta between 1 and 2 pH units.
rationale: Simplified using "pH delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of pH conditions that support an organism's growth, with a range between 2 and 3 pH units. Values ranging from 2 to 3 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH delta between 2 and 3 pH units.
rationale: Simplified using "pH delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of pH conditions that support an organism's growth, with a range between 3 and 4 pH units. Values ranging from 3 to 4 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH delta between 3 and 4 pH units.
rationale: Simplified using "pH delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of pH conditions that support an organism's growth, with a range between 4 and 5 pH units. Values ranging from 4 to 5 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH delta between 4 and 5 pH units.
rationale: Simplified using "pH delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of pH conditions that support an organism's growth, with a wide range between 5 and 9 pH units. Values ranging from 5 to 9 pH.
proposed_definition: A pH delta between 5 and 9 pH units.
rationale: Simplified using "pH delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of sodium chloride concentrations that support an organism's growth, with a narrow range less than 1%. Values with maximum value of 1 C.
proposed_definition: A NaCl delta of less than 1% concentration.
rationale: Simplified using "NaCl delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of sodium chloride concentrations that support an organism's growth, with a range between 1% and 3%. Values ranging from 1 to 3 C.
proposed_definition: A NaCl delta between 1% and 3% concentration.
rationale: Simplified using "NaCl delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of sodium chloride concentrations that support an organism's growth, with a range between 3% and 8%. Values ranging from 3 to 8 C.
proposed_definition: A NaCl delta between 3% and 8% concentration.
rationale: Simplified using "NaCl delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of sodium chloride concentrations that support an organism's growth, with a wide range greater than 8%. Values with maximum value of 8 C.
proposed_definition: A NaCl delta greater than 8% concentration.
rationale: Simplified using "NaCl delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of temperatures that support an organism's growth, with a narrow range between 1°C and 5°C. Values ranging from 1 to 5 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature delta between 1°C and 5°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of temperatures that support an organism's growth, with a range between 5°C and 10°C. Values ranging from 5 to 10 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature delta between 5°C and 10°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of temperatures that support an organism's growth, with a range between 10°C and 20°C. Values ranging from 10 to 20 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature delta between 10°C and 20°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of temperatures that support an organism's growth, with a range between 20°C and 30°C. Values ranging from 20 to 30 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature delta between 20°C and 30°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature delta" as genus.

current_definition: A growth tolerance metric measuring the span of temperatures that support an organism's growth, with a wide range greater than 30°C. Values with minimum value of 30 C.
proposed_definition: A temperature delta greater than 30°C.
rationale: Simplified using "temperature delta" as genus.

current_definition: An organism or virus or viron that is too small to be viewed by the unaided eye.
proposed_definition: A material entity that is a microscopic organism including bacteria, archaea, fungi, protists, and viruses.
rationale: Current is good, minor rewrite to use "material entity" as genus and be more inclusive.

current_definition: A physical entity of interest in chemistry including molecular entities, parts thereof, and chemical substances.
proposed_definition: A material entity of interest in chemistry including molecular entities, parts thereof, and chemical substances.
rationale: Changed "physical entity" to "material entity" to match METPO hierarchy.

proposed_definition: A phenotype that relates to the rate and extent of microbial growth as affected by hydrogen ion concentration of the environment.
source_terms_consulted: OMP:0005008 (pH effects on population growth phenotype)
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus, focusing on pH-related growth characteristics.

proposed_definition: A phenotype that relates to the rate and extent of microbial growth as affected by salt concentration of the environment.
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus, focusing on salinity-related growth characteristics.

proposed_definition: A phenotype that relates to the rate and extent of microbial growth as affected by the thermal properties of the environment.
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus, focusing on temperature-related growth characteristics.

proposed_definition: A phenotype that quantifies the breadth of environmental conditions a microorganism can tolerate.
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus, focusing on tolerance breadth.

metpo_label: growth range phenotype with numerical limits
proposed_definition: A phenotype that encompasses the span of environmental conditions within which a microorganism can sustain growth.
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus, focusing on growth-permissive range.

proposed_definition: A phenotype that represents the environmental conditions at which a microorganism exhibits maximum growth rate.
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus, focusing on optimal growth conditions.

proposed_definition: A phenotype that relates to an organism's ability to grow in the presence or absence of molecular oxygen.
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus.

current_definition: A microbial oxygen preference phenotype in which growth occurs in the presence of molecular oxygen (O₂), typically using O₂ as the terminal electron acceptor.
proposed_definition: An oxygen preference where growth occurs in the presence of molecular oxygen.
rationale: Current is good, simplified to be more concise using "oxygen preference" as genus.

current_definition: A microbial oxygen preference phenotype in which growth occurs in the absence of molecular oxygen (O₂).
proposed_definition: An oxygen preference where growth occurs in the absence of molecular oxygen.
rationale: Current is good, simplified using "oxygen preference" as genus.

current_definition: A microbial oxygen preference phenotype that requires molecular oxygen (O₂) at concentrations lower than atmospheric.
proposed_definition: An oxygen preference where growth requires molecular oxygen at concentrations lower than atmospheric levels.
rationale: Current is good, rewritten using "oxygen preference" as genus.

current_definition: A microbial oxygen preference phenotype in which growth can occur with or without molecular oxygen (O₂).
proposed_definition: An oxygen preference where growth can occur with or without molecular oxygen.
rationale: Current is good, simplified using "oxygen preference" as genus.

current_definition: A microbial oxygen preference phenotype that requires molecular oxygen (O₂) for growth.
proposed_definition: An oxygen preference where molecular oxygen is required for growth.
rationale: New definition using "oxygen preference" as genus.

current_definition: A microbial oxygen preference phenotype in which molecular oxygen (O₂) inhibits or prevents growth.
proposed_definition: An oxygen preference where molecular oxygen inhibits or prevents growth.
rationale: Current is good, simplified using "oxygen preference" as genus.

current_definition: A microbial oxygen preference phenotype in which growth can occur without oxygen but is capable of aerobic growth.
proposed_definition: An oxygen preference where growth occurs without oxygen but aerobic growth is possible.
rationale: Rewritten using "oxygen preference" as genus.

current_definition: A microbial oxygen preference phenotype that does not use O₂ for growth but tolerates its presence.
proposed_definition: An oxygen preference where oxygen is not used for growth but its presence is tolerated.
rationale: Current is good, rewritten using "oxygen preference" as genus.

current_definition: A microbial oxygen preference phenotype that tolerates low levels of molecular oxygen (O₂) without requiring it.
proposed_definition: An oxygen preference where low levels of molecular oxygen are tolerated without being required for growth.
rationale: Current is good, rewritten using "oxygen preference" as genus.

current_definition: A microbial oxygen preference phenotype reported as "strictly anaerobic" in Madin; modeled distinctly and placed under obligately anaerobic.
proposed_definition: An obligately anaerobic phenotype characterized by complete intolerance to molecular oxygen.
rationale: Uses "obligately anaerobic" as genus, differentiating by complete intolerance.

current_definition: A microbial oxygen preference phenotype reported generically as "facultative" (no direction specified); kept as its own class to avoid collapsing specific subclasses.
proposed_definition: An oxygen preference where growth occurs both in the presence and absence of molecular oxygen without specification of preference direction.
rationale: Uses "oxygen preference" as genus, characterizes ambiguous facultative state.

current_definition: A microbial phenotype describing characteristic growth with respect to environmental temperature (e.g., preference classes such as psychrophilic, mesophilic, thermophilic, hyperthermophilic).
proposed_definition: A phenotype that characterizes an organism's preferred temperature range for optimal growth.
rationale: Current is good, rewritten to genus-differentia using "phenotype" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature preference phenotype in which growth is favored at low temperatures, typically near or below ~15 °C.
proposed_definition: A temperature preference where growth is favored at low temperatures, typically at or below 15°C.
rationale: Current is good, rewritten using "temperature preference" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature preference phenotype in which growth is favored at intermediate temperatures, typically ~20–45 °C.
proposed_definition: A temperature preference where growth is favored at intermediate temperatures, typically 20-45°C.
rationale: Current is good, rewritten using "temperature preference" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature preference phenotype in which growth is favored at elevated temperatures, typically ≥45 °C.
proposed_definition: A temperature preference where growth is favored at elevated temperatures, typically 45°C or higher.
rationale: Current is good, rewritten using "temperature preference" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature preference phenotype in which growth is favored at very high temperatures, typically ≥80 °C.
proposed_definition: A temperature preference where growth is favored at very high temperatures, typically 80°C or higher.
rationale: Current is good, rewritten using "temperature preference" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature tolerance phenotype in which growth can occur at low temperatures without an obligate low-temperature preference.
proposed_definition: A temperature preference where growth can occur at low temperatures without requiring them for optimal growth.
rationale: Current is good, rewritten using "temperature preference" as genus.

current_definition: A temperature tolerance phenotype in which growth can occur at elevated temperatures without an obligate high-temperature preference.
proposed_definition: A temperature preference where growth can occur at elevated temperatures without requiring them for optimal growth.
rationale: Current is good, rewritten using "temperature preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A halophily preference where growth is favored at elevated salt concentrations.
rationale: New definition using "halophily preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A halophily preference where growth requires both elevated salt concentration and alkaline pH.
rationale: New definition using "halophily preference" as genus, combining salt and pH requirements.

proposed_definition: A halophily preference where growth can occur at elevated salt concentrations without requiring them.
rationale: New definition using "halophily preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A halophily preference where growth is favored at moderate salt concentrations, typically 3-15% NaCl.
rationale: New definition using "halophily preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A halophily preference where growth occurs at low salt concentrations and is inhibited by elevated salinity.
rationale: New definition using "halophily preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A halophily preference where growth is favored at slightly elevated salt concentrations, typically 1-3% NaCl.
rationale: New definition using "halophily preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A halophily preference where growth occurs only within a narrow range of salt concentrations.
rationale: New definition using "halophily preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A halophily preference where growth can occur across a broad range of salt concentrations.
rationale: New definition using "halophily preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A halophily preference where growth requires very high salt concentrations, typically above 15% NaCl.
rationale: New definition using "halophily preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A phenotype that characterizes an organism's preferred salinity range for growth.
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus.

current_definition: The execution of a genetically-encoded biological module or program. It consists of all the steps required to achieve the specific biological objective of the module. A biological process is accomplished by a particular set of molecular functions carried out by specific gene products (or macromolecular complexes), often in a highly regulated manner and in a particular temporal sequence.
proposed_definition: A process that involves the activities of living organisms or their parts, occurring at the molecular, cellular, tissue, organ, or whole-organism level.
rationale: Current GO definition is complex. Simplified while maintaining genus-differentia structure.

current_definition: The quality of how an organism obtains its carbon and energy.
proposed_definition: A phenotype that characterizes how an organism acquires carbon and energy for growth and metabolism.
rationale: Rewritten using "phenotype" as genus, clarifying what trophic type characterizes.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism synthesizes organic compounds from inorganic carbon sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from the oxidation of carbon monoxide.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from inorganic chemical oxidation and carbon from inorganic sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from chemical oxidation and carbon from inorganic sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives both energy and carbon from organic compounds.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from inorganic chemical oxidation and carbon from carbon dioxide or other inorganic carbon sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from inorganic chemical oxidation and carbon from organic sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from the oxidation of inorganic compounds.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from organic chemical oxidation and carbon from organic sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from chemical oxidation reactions.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A nutrient adaptation where an organism thrives in environments with high nutrient availability.
rationale: New definition using "nutrient adaptation" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism obtains carbon from organic sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism uses molecular hydrogen as an electron donor.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from inorganic substrates and carbon from inorganic sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from inorganic substrates and carbon from organic sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from inorganic substrates.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism uses methane as its primary carbon and energy source.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism uses reduced one-carbon compounds as its primary carbon and energy source.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism can switch between different energy and carbon acquisition strategies depending on environmental conditions.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A nutrient adaptation where an organism thrives in environments with low nutrient availability.
rationale: New definition using "nutrient adaptation" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from the oxidation of organic compounds.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from light and carbon from inorganic sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from light and carbon from organic sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from light and electrons from inorganic donors.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from light, electrons from organic donors, and carbon from organic sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from light.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from the oxidation of organic compounds.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives both energy and carbon from organic compounds, typically the same compounds.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type where an organism derives energy from light, electrons from inorganic donors, and carbon from inorganic sources.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

proposed_definition: A phenotype that characterizes the morphological form of a microbial cell.
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is elongated and cylindrical, resembling a rod.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is roughly spherical.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is curved like a crescent moon, with a concave and convex side.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is bent or arched.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape where spherical cells occur in pairs due to incomplete separation after division.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus, includes arrangement.

proposed_definition: A cell shape resembling a dumbbell, with two roughly spherical regions connected by a narrower segment.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is oval with two axes of symmetry.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape where cells form long, thread-like structures.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape resembling a flask, with a wider base tapering to a narrow neck.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is coiled or wound in a helix.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is egg-shaped, with one end broader than the other.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is elliptical or oval.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape where cells exhibit variable morphology, taking on multiple different forms during their life cycle or under different conditions.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that forms a closed circular structure.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is elongated and cylindrical with a relatively uniform diameter.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape characteristic of spores, typically small and ovoid or spherical with a thick protective wall.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is perfectly spherical, with all points on the surface equidistant from the center.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that forms a rigid corkscrew or helical structure.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape with multiple projections radiating from a central point, resembling a star.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is curved or comma-shaped, forming an incomplete arc.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape where cells or filaments divide into branches.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is intermediate between a sphere and a rod, being shorter and thicker than a typical rod but more elongated than a sphere.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is flat and circular, like a disc, with the diameter much greater than the height.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is spindle-shaped, wide in the middle and tapering at both ends.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that lacks a consistent or predictable form, varying unpredictably in outline.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that is elongated with tapered ends, widest in the middle.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape that forms a flexible spiral or helical structure, capable of flexing and rotating.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape with four approximately equal sides and right angles, forming a square or cubic appearance.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape with a distinct tail-like appendage or extension.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A cell shape with three sides forming triangular geometry.
rationale: New definition using "cell shape" as genus.

proposed_definition: A phenotype that characterizes the ability of a cell to retain crystal violet stain when decolorized, reflecting cell wall structure.
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus.

proposed_definition: A gram stain where cells retain crystal violet stain after decolorization, indicating a thick peptidoglycan layer.
rationale: New definition using "gram stain" as genus.

proposed_definition: A gram stain where cells do not retain crystal violet stain after decolorization, indicating a thin peptidoglycan layer and outer membrane.
rationale: New definition using "gram stain" as genus.

proposed_definition: A gram stain where cells inconsistently retain crystal violet stain, showing mixed or variable staining within a population.
rationale: New definition using "gram stain" as genus.

proposed_definition: A phenotype that characterizes the ability and manner of a microorganism to move.
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus.

proposed_definition: A motility where the organism is capable of self-propelled movement.
rationale: New definition using "motility" as genus.

proposed_definition: A motility where the organism lacks the ability for self-propelled movement.
rationale: New definition using "motility" as genus.

proposed_definition: A motility where movement is achieved through one or more flagella.
rationale: New definition using "motile" as genus (subclass).

proposed_definition: A motility where movement is achieved through axial filaments located between the cell wall and outer membrane.
rationale: New definition using "motile" as genus.

proposed_definition: A motility where movement occurs along a solid surface without apparent appendages.
rationale: New definition using "motile" as genus.

proposed_definition: A temperature preference where growth occurs optimally at low temperatures but can also occur at moderate temperatures.
rationale: New definition using "temperature preference" as genus.

current_definition: A microorganism that grows optimally at temperatures above 90°C.
proposed_definition: A temperature preference where growth is favored at extremely high temperatures, typically above 90°C.
rationale: Rewritten using "temperature preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A trophic type that characterizes an organism's adaptation to environments with varying nutrient availability.
rationale: New definition using "trophic type" as genus.

current_definition: An organism's observable and characteristic method of performing cellular respiration, distinguished primarily by the specific terminal electron acceptor its metabolic pathways utilize for the purpose of producing cellular energy.
proposed_definition: A metabolic process where energy is derived from the transfer of electrons to a terminal electron acceptor.
rationale: Rewritten using "metabolic process" as genus, simplified.

proposed_definition: A respiration where molecular oxygen serves as the terminal electron acceptor.
rationale: New definition using "respiration" as genus.

proposed_definition: A respiration where inorganic or organic compounds other than molecular oxygen serve as the terminal electron acceptor.
rationale: New definition using "respiration" as genus.

proposed_definition: A metabolic process where ATP is synthesized using energy released from the transfer of electrons through an electron transport chain to a terminal electron acceptor.
rationale: New definition using "metabolic process" as genus.

proposed_definition: A metabolic process where ATP is synthesized directly from the transfer of a phosphate group from a high-energy substrate molecule to ADP.
rationale: New definition using "metabolic process" as genus.

proposed_definition: A metabolic process involving the movement of electrons from an electron donor to an electron acceptor.
rationale: New definition using "metabolic process" as genus.

proposed_definition: A metabolic process where a single compound is simultaneously oxidized and reduced, serving as both electron donor and electron acceptor.
rationale: New definition using "metabolic process" as genus.

proposed_definition: A metabolic process where methane is produced as an end product of anaerobic respiration.
rationale: New definition using "metabolic process" as genus.

proposed_definition: A metabolic process where acetate is produced as an end product of anaerobic metabolism.
rationale: New definition using "metabolic process" as genus.

proposed_definition: A metabolic process where acetate is produced from carbon dioxide via the reductive acetyl-CoA pathway.
rationale: New definition using "metabolic process" as genus.

proposed_definition: A phenotype that characterizes the ability to form dormant, highly resistant spore structures.
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus.

proposed_definition: A sporulation where spores are produced.
rationale: New definition using "sporulation" as genus.

proposed_definition: A sporulation where spores are not produced.
rationale: New definition using "sporulation" as genus.

current_definition: A quality of a cell relating to its measurement from end to end.
proposed_definition: A phenotype that quantifies the linear extent of a cell measured along its longest axis.
rationale: Rewritten using "phenotype" as genus, more precise terminology.

current_definition: A quality of a cell relating to its measurement from side to side.
proposed_definition: A phenotype that quantifies the linear extent of a cell measured perpendicular to its longest axis.
rationale: Rewritten using "phenotype" as genus, more precise terminology.

current_definition: A cell length quality of being less than or equal to 1.3 micrometers.
proposed_definition: A cell length of 1.3 micrometers or less.
rationale: Simplified using "cell length" as genus.

current_definition: A cell length quality of being between 1.3 and 2 micrometers.
proposed_definition: A cell length between 1.3 and 2 micrometers.
rationale: Simplified using "cell length" as genus.

current_definition: A cell length quality of being between 2 and 3 micrometers.
proposed_definition: A cell length between 2 and 3 micrometers.
rationale: Simplified using "cell length" as genus.

current_definition: A cell length quality of being greater than 3 micrometers.
proposed_definition: A cell length of 3 micrometers or more.
rationale: Simplified using "cell length" as genus.

current_definition: A cell width quality of being less than or equal to 0.5 micrometers.
proposed_definition: A cell width of 0.5 micrometers or less.
rationale: Simplified using "cell width" as genus.

current_definition: A cell width quality of being between 0.5 and 0.65 micrometers.
proposed_definition: A cell width between 0.5 and 0.65 micrometers.
rationale: Simplified using "cell width" as genus.

current_definition: A cell width quality of being between 0.65 and 0.9 micrometers.
proposed_definition: A cell width between 0.65 and 0.9 micrometers.
rationale: Simplified using "cell width" as genus.

current_definition: A cell width quality of being greater than 0.9 micrometers.
proposed_definition: A cell width of 0.9 micrometers or more.
rationale: Simplified using "cell width" as genus.

current_definition: A recording of the output of a measurement such as produced by a device.
proposed_definition: A recording of a measurement or observation of a property or characteristic.
rationale: Root class, simplified from IAO definition.

current_definition: An observation specializing temperature observation for optimum temperature data.
proposed_definition: An observation that records the temperature at which maximum growth occurs.
rationale: Uses "observation" as genus, specifies what is observed.

current_definition: An observation specializing temperature observation for general growth temperature data.
proposed_definition: An observation that records a temperature at which growth occurs.
rationale: Uses "observation" as genus.

current_definition: An observation specializing temperature observation for growth temperature range data.
proposed_definition: An observation that records the range of temperatures within which growth occurs.
rationale: Uses "observation" as genus.

current_definition: An observation specializing temperature observation for tolerance breadth (delta) data.
proposed_definition: An observation that records the breadth of temperatures tolerated, calculated as maximum minus minimum.
rationale: Uses "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records a sodium chloride concentration at which growth occurs.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records the breadth of sodium chloride concentrations tolerated.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records the range of sodium chloride concentrations within which growth occurs.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records the sodium chloride concentration at which maximum growth occurs.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records a pH value at which growth occurs.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records the pH value at which maximum growth occurs.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records the breadth of pH values tolerated.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records the range of pH values within which growth occurs.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records the oxygen concentration at which maximum growth occurs.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records an oxygen concentration at which growth occurs.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records the range of oxygen concentrations within which growth occurs.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records the breadth of oxygen concentrations tolerated.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records an oxygen concentration or oxygen-related measurement.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records a temperature or temperature-related measurement.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records a sodium chloride concentration or salinity-related measurement.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: An observation that records a pH value or hydrogen ion concentration measurement.
rationale: New definition using "observation" as genus.

proposed_definition: A quality that characterizes the degree of biocontainment precautions required to safely handle an organism.
rationale: New definition using "quality" as genus.

proposed_definition: A biosafety level requiring minimal containment, for agents not known to consistently cause disease in healthy adults.
rationale: New definition using "biosafety level" as genus.

proposed_definition: A biosafety level requiring moderate containment, for agents of moderate potential hazard to personnel and environment.
rationale: New definition using "biosafety level" as genus.

proposed_definition: A biosafety level requiring containment, for indigenous or exotic agents with potential for aerosol transmission and serious or lethal infection.
rationale: New definition using "biosafety level" as genus.

proposed_definition: A biosafety level requiring maximum containment, for dangerous and exotic agents with high individual risk of life-threatening disease.
rationale: New definition using "biosafety level" as genus.

proposed_definition: A biosafety level requiring enhanced maximum containment beyond level 4.
rationale: New definition using "biosafety level" as genus (uncommon level).

proposed_definition: A metabolic process where electrons are conducted over centimeter-scale distances through multicellular filamentous structures.
rationale: New definition using "metabolic process" as genus, describes unique cable bacteria metabolism.

proposed_definition: A metabolic process where energy is derived from substrate-level phosphorylation without an external electron acceptor.
rationale: New definition, though fermentation is not technically respiration. Uses parent class as genus.

proposed_definition: A metabolic process where two or more organisms cooperate to degrade substrates that neither can metabolize alone.
rationale: New definition using "metabolic process" as genus.

proposed_definition: A phenotype that characterizes an organism's preferred pH range for optimal growth.
rationale: New definition using "phenotype" as genus.

proposed_definition: A pH growth preference where growth is favored at neutral pH, typically between pH 6 and 8.
rationale: New definition using "pH growth preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A pH growth preference where growth is favored at alkaline pH, typically above pH 8.
rationale: New definition using "pH growth preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A pH growth preference where growth is favored at acidic pH, typically below pH 6.
rationale: New definition using "pH growth preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A pH growth preference where alkaline pH is required for growth.
rationale: New definition using "pH growth preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A pH growth preference where growth occurs at alkaline pH but can also occur at neutral pH.
rationale: New definition using "pH growth preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A pH growth preference where acidic pH is required for growth.
rationale: New definition using "pH growth preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A pH growth preference where growth occurs at acidic pH but can also occur at neutral pH.
rationale: New definition using "pH growth preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A pH growth preference where acidic pH is tolerated but not required for growth.
rationale: New definition using "pH growth preference" as genus.

proposed_definition: A pH growth preference where alkaline pH is tolerated but not required for growth.
rationale: New definition using "pH growth preference" as genus.

current_definition: A phenotype characterized by the color of pigments produced by a microorganism.
proposed_definition: A phenotype that characterizes the production and color of pigments by a microorganism.
rationale: Rewritten using "phenotype" as genus.

current_definition: A phenotype characterized by the production of black-colored pigments.
proposed_definition: A pigmentation where black-colored pigments are produced.
rationale: Uses "pigmentation" as genus.

current_definition: A phenotype characterized by the production of brown-colored pigments.
proposed_definition: A pigmentation where brown-colored pigments are produced.
rationale: Uses "pigmentation" as genus.

current_definition: A phenotype characterized by the production of cream-colored pigments.
proposed_definition: A pigmentation where cream-colored pigments are produced.
rationale: Uses "pigmentation" as genus.

current_definition: A phenotype characterized by the production of green-colored pigments.
proposed_definition: A pigmentation where green-colored pigments are produced.
rationale: Uses "pigmentation" as genus.

current_definition: A phenotype characterized by the production of orange-colored pigments.
proposed_definition: A pigmentation where orange-colored pigments are produced.
rationale: Uses "pigmentation" as genus.

current_definition: A phenotype characterized by the production of pink-colored pigments.
proposed_definition: A pigmentation where pink-colored pigments are produced.
rationale: Uses "pigmentation" as genus.

current_definition: A phenotype characterized by the production of red-colored pigments.
proposed_definition: A pigmentation where red-colored pigments are produced.
rationale: Uses "pigmentation" as genus.

current_definition: A phenotype characterized by the production of white-colored pigments.
proposed_definition: A pigmentation where white-colored pigments are produced.
rationale: Uses "pigmentation" as genus.

current_definition: A phenotype characterized by the production of yellow-colored pigments.
proposed_definition: A pigmentation where yellow-colored pigments are produced.
rationale: Uses "pigmentation" as genus.

current_definition: A phenotype characterized by the production of carotenoid pigments.
proposed_definition: A pigmentation where carotenoid pigments are produced.
rationale: Uses "pigmentation" as genus.

current_definition: A pathogenicity phenotype where a microbe is a pathogen of of some host organism.
proposed_definition: A phenotype where a microbe causes disease in a host organism.
rationale: Rewritten using "phenotype" as genus, corrected typo.

current_definition: A pathogenicity phenotype where a microbe is a pathogen of animals (Metazoa).
proposed_definition: A pathogenic to host phenotype where the host is an animal organism.
rationale: Uses "pathogenic to host" as genus.

current_definition: A pathogenicity phenotype where a microbe is a pathogen of plants (Viridiplantae).
proposed_definition: A pathogenic to host phenotype where the host is a plant organism.
rationale: Uses "pathogenic to host" as genus.

current_definition: A pathogenicity phenotype where a microbe is a pathogen of humans (Homo sapiens).
proposed_definition: A pathogenic to host phenotype where the host is a human.
rationale: Uses "pathogenic to host" as genus.
